headline: Burger King to enter China joint venture, plans to double stores
summary: US fast-food chain Burger King will rapidly expand its China operations in coming years, its parent company said, selling its controlling stake to form a new joint venture powered by hundreds of millions of dollars in local investment.The latest shake-up follows an announcement last week by Starbucks that it will sell a controlling stake in its China retail operations.

content.title: Burger King to enter China joint venture, plans to double stores
content.summary: US fast-food chain Burger King will rapidly expand its China operations in coming years, its parent company said, selling its controlling stake to form a new joint venture powered by hundreds of millions of dollars in local investment.The latest shake-up follows an announcement last week by Starbucks that it will sell a controlling stake in its China retail operations.

thumbnail.caption: With its new Burger King China venture, the fast-food chain aims to double its number of stores in the country within five years (WANG Zhao)
